Description: Small globular jar of marl pottery with a round base, two pierced cylindrical handles on the shoulder and a flat ledge rim; made into the form of a bird by the addition of a head and tail; decorated all over the body with horizontal wavy lines in red-brown paint.
Curator's comments: Like Fancy ware type F69P in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery. Published: M. Murray, Figure Vases in Egypt, in: Petrie et al., Historical Studies, London (1911) p. 43, pl. xxiii, 28 (ex MacGregor collection).
